meanings.definition: Capable of being placed in a net.
meanings.sent1: The small fish was nettable and easily caught by the fishermen.
meanings.sent2: The butterflies were nettable creatures, fluttering gracefully into the net.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought the shiny objects were nettable toys to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like nettable butterflies, delicate and easily captured but fleeting.
meanings.sent5: The idea of happiness seemed as nettable as a butterfly, always just out of reach.

meanings.definition: Suitable for inclusion in a net.
meanings.sent1: The ripe fruits were nettable and ready to be gathered in the net.
meanings.sent2: The falling leaves were nettable, perfect for collecting in the net for composting.
meanings.sent3: The colorful candies looked nettable, tempting to catch in a net and eat.
meanings.sent4: Her words were nettable treasures, easily captured and cherished in the net of memory.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky appeared as nettable jewels, waiting to be caught in the net of wonder.

meanings.definition: Able to be captured or contained in a net.
meanings.sent1: The escaped bird was nettable and soon safely back in its cage.
meanings.sent2: The mischievous squirrel was nettable, finally caught in the net set by the park ranger.
meanings.sent3: The misbehaving child seemed nettable, always finding a way to escape punishment.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were nettable, caught in the web of worries and fears.
meanings.sent5: The elusive truth was as nettable as a fish, slipping away whenever he tried to grasp it.
